author: jondepinet
title: Lobbying for favorable legislation
description: Comment pouvons-nous nous défendre en permanence contre les attaques des gouvernements, les législations compromettantes et les politiques fiscales injustes ?

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with Fund 8 Strategic Goal of prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem. To improve challenge: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than 1 of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The challenge budget is for $300,000 even though there was only a total of $282,842 in proposal budget requests in Fund 7 so there is some doubt as to whether the community has the capacity to address the challenge to the scale of the funding request. The community does have the skills and interest required though. There are no significantly overlapping challenges. 
To improve challenge: better articulate the demonstrated demand for the proposed budget (most easily done based upon excess total proposal budgets in previous funding rounds).
f6_assessments.q2: The challenge does a good job of articulating the success criteria and the suggested metrics clearly measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
Laws and regulations are determining the adaptation of blockchain and the view of the public on it.

Having favorable legislation can lead to the improvement of the whole sector.

I find this proposal in accordance with the cardano mission.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The lawyers and lobbyists are rare goods, so it is questionable how much we can engage the community, yet I believe it is possible. 

Rating given 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
some of KPIs:

Number of jurisdictions favored through lobbying
Number of laws that have been modified
Number of experts in regulation, lawyers, and other members involved
Number of partnerships and collaborations with organizations and non-profits that work in the same cause
Number of votes of politicians engaged

It is hard for me to imagine a situation where we could be able to distinguish how many of these KPIs were achieved using proposals from such funds, or what was just a coincidence. Even if a law was changed and favored through lobbying, can we say it was because of some proposals? 

I am not sure if we cna decisively determine the impact of the challenge. 

Rating given 3.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree with this proposal's alignment, since: I believe that creating a favorable regulatory environment [related to privacy assurance, transparent public finance,...] is a necessary condition to promote the application of Cardano blockchain in social life. . If the opposite happens, what we get is an environment that is either full of surprises or too volatile full of uncertainty.
f6_assessments.q1:
The community currently has the technical capacity and other requirements to meet this challenge ? I am still neutral with this. However, the ongoing effects at Fund 7 show positive signs when the number of submitted proposals is quite significant, the level of interest of the community [from my perspective] is to be expected.
Therefore, I can agree with this proposal's feasibility
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided clear, logical, and measurable metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge. I strongly agree with this proposal's verifiability.

f6_assessments.q0: Enabling a favorable legislation is critical not only for Cardano's mission but also to most of blockchains. Lobbying is one way to get there, but maybe not the only one. I suggest opening a little bit the challenge, for example by enabling projects that would try to understand public authorities fears and expectations and offer a solution using Dapps for example.
f6_assessments.q1:
As this idea of this challenge is to fund specialists of public policies and lawiers, the capacity of the Catalyst Community to effectively address this challenge depends on how much these skills are present in the community. 
Based on my experience of Catatalyst proposals, I can say that we have several law specialists in the community, but this skill is not highly represented.
 The challenge brief does not mention an established challenge team.
I neither agree nor disagree that the community has the capacity to address this challenge
f6_assessments.q2:
Success criteria are defined, though they are not very objective (ex. Delaying a legislation compromising adoption). 
Metrics are based on the number of partnerships and a qualitative estimation of an increase in favorable law. My understanding is that these metrics of the progress of proposers in addressing the challenge are not easy to measure. 
I neither agree nor disagree that success criteria and progress metrics are set to enable a correct measure of the progress in addressing the challenge.

importance: Pour que nous disposions d'une législation favorable, d'une protection de la vie privée, d'une réduction des impôts et d'un environnement positif pour l'adoption massive des crypto-monnaies.
success: Nous avons réussi à retarder ou à annuler des lois qui compromettent l'adoption de la crypto et à soutenir les communautés locales et les organisations comme Coincenter.
